Interface GoGame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GoGrid

    public interface GoGame
    An interface for Go games
    Version:
    CS56 7/20/16
    Author:
    David Winkenwerder and Dustin Henderson, Keith Waldron and Nick Abrahan, Jeffrey Liu and Lauren Dumapias, Chunqing Liu and Xingyuan Zhang
    See Also:
    GoGrid, GoComponent, Go

    • Method Detail

      • getTurn

        char getTurn()
        returns 'B' or 'W' depending on whose turn it is. Returns ' ' if game over.

      • setTurn

        void setTurn(char turn)
        used to set the turn

      • isBlank

        boolean isBlank(int i)
        is this square blank. Should be called before move() to see whether the move is legal.
        Parameters:
        i - number between 1 and 361 indicating square
        Returns:
        whether square is blank or not.

      • makeMove

        boolean makeMove(int i)
          throws GoIllegalMoveException
        play the next move. if isBlank(i) is not true, will throw GoIllegalMoveException.
        Parameters:
        i - number between 1 and 361 indicating square, organized like a telephone grid. If i is already occupied, a GoMoveException is thrown.
        Returns:
        winner 'B', 'W', or 'D' for draw, or ' ' for none yet.
        Throws:
        GoIllegalMoveException

      • getWinner

        char getWinner()
        Allows the game to end when both parties are surrendering

      • setSurrendering

        void setSurrendering()
        Allows to set surrendering condition true

        void restart()
        Allows the game to restart
